meanings.definition: To write a book or article together with someone else.
meanings.sent1: She and her friend coauthored a story for their school project.
meanings.sent2: The two authors coauthored a best-selling novel last year.
meanings.sent3: The students coauthored a hilarious comic book about their teachers.
meanings.sent4: Their collaboration coauthored a new chapter in the history of literature.
meanings.sent5: Working together, they coauthored a masterpiece that captivated readers.

meanings.definition: Having been written by two or more people.
meanings.sent1: The coauthored research paper received praise from the professors.
meanings.sent2: The coauthored screenplay won an award at the film festival.
meanings.sent3: The coauthored cookbook featured recipes from chefs around the world.
meanings.sent4: The coauthored thesis presented a unique perspective on the topic.
meanings.sent5: The coauthored biography provided a comprehensive look at the famous artist's life.
